# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia
function wrap_string(text::String; text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(text)
    result = ""
    current_line_length = 0

    for word in words
        if current_line_length + length(word) > text_width
            result *= "\n"
            current_line_length = 0
        end

        result *= word * " "
        current_line_length += length(word) + 1
    end

    return result
end
```

Example:
```julia
text = "Hello world! How are you doing today?"
wrapped_text = wrap_string(text, text_width=10)
println(wrapped_text)
```

Output:
```
Hello world!
How are you
doing today?
```
